intro: Inga latibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract inga, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its rapid growth and ability to fix nitrogen make it ecologically significant in forest ecosystems.
